p: Rhinacanthus nasutus is a medicinal herb rich in carotenoids that has anticancer activity [ 121]. Ho et al. [ 122] isolated the carotenoids from R. nasutus to prepare microemulsions with enhanced oral bioavailability in rats. The microemulsions were prepared using Capryol 90, Transcutol, and Tween 80, and the mean size was 10.4 nm. A carotenoid suspension or microemulsions were fed to rats at a dose of 20 mg/kg. The absolute bioavailability of carotenoids was 0.11% for the aqueous dispersion and 0.45% for the microemulsions.
